Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists (Copenhagen, 1994) pp. 484-487.

In BM 1075 (British Library Ms. Or. 6046) a single Egyptian village is generating almost five pounds of gold in tax revenue. Amounts are recorded in two different kinds of terms, in (notional) gold (i.e. money of account) and in bronze (i.e. the actual small currency in circulation).
